byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu and Andrew W. Lehren contributed reporting.

abstract: Old fears about government conspiracy have resurfaced in Turkey following deadly suicide bombings in Ankara; many Turks have long believed that entity known as 'deep state' is manipulating events to provoke violence for political gain; theories are seen as way of making sense of mounting chaos in country.
lead_paragraph: Some in Turkey see a secretive government cabal, the “deep state,” manipulating events in the nation, an indication of Turkey’s political polarization and instability.

headline.main: When Turmoil Strikes, Turks See Conspiracy at Work
headline.print_headline: When Turmoil Strikes, Turks See Conspiracy at Work

snippet: Some in Turkey see a secretive government cabal, the “deep state,” manipulating events in the nation, an indication of Turkey’s political polarization and instability.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
